channel.title: Slight problem

item.title: Slight problem
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

josdog:

It looks like either your config/instances.txt is not there or your machine is too slow to run the server. (I read the error… :D)

It has nothing to do with that, even though it was telling me the config/instances.txt couldn’t be loaded it was.

It’s fixed now, used a more unique method.

item.title: Slight problem
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I’ve been trying to get this fixed now, I created another framework and I’m getting problems while running.

I am trying to run it through Eclipse, seems my Command prompt is being gay. But I get this problem.

Loading GV - Saphire
Could not load instance config file.

The server.class file shows warning symbols for the main method, here’s my main method

[code] public static void main(java.lang.String args[]) {
System.out.println(“Loading GV - Saphire`”);
clientHandler = new Server();
IOThread = new IOThread();
playerHandler = PlayerHandler.getSingleton();
EventManager.initialise();
instanceManager = InstanceManager.getSingleton();
try {
InstanceLoader.load(instanceManager, “config/instances.txt”);
} catch (Exception e) {
System.err.println(“Could not load instance config file.”);
System.exit(-1);
}

    (new Thread(IOThread)).start();
    (new Thread(clientHandler)).start();

    int waitFails = 0;
    long lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
    long totalTimeSpentProcessing = 0;
    int cycle = 0;
    while (!shutdownServer) {
        playerHandler.process();
        EventManager.getSingleton().shutdown();
        instanceManager.process();
        long timeSpent = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastTicks;
        totalTimeSpentProcessing += timeSpent;
        if (timeSpent >= cycleTime) {
            timeSpent = cycleTime;
            if (++waitFails > 100) {
                shutdownServer = true;
                Misc.println("[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!");
            }
        }

        try {
            Thread.sleep(cycleTime - timeSpent);
        } catch (java.lang.Exception _ex) {
        }
        lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
        cycle++;
        if (cycle % 100 == 0) {
            @SuppressWarnings("unused")
            float time = ((float) totalTimeSpentProcessing) / cycle;
            Misc.println_debug("[KERNEL]: " + (time * 100 / cycleTime) + "% processing time");
        }
    }[/code]

Appreciate the help.

EDIT: Fixed, I tried another method of loading configuration files through SQL server and it worked.

Read full topic
